sen.j: 仁賢天皇（にんけんてんのう、允恭天皇38年（449年） - 仁賢天皇11年8月8日 (旧暦)（498年9月9日））は、第24代の天皇（在位：仁賢天皇元年1月5日 (旧暦)（488年2月4日） - 同11年8月8日（498年9月9日））。
sen.e: Emperor Ninken (449 – September 10, 498; reign: February 3, 488 – September 10, 498) was the twenty-fourth emperor of Japan.
Emperor Ninken (449 – September 9, 498) was the twenty-fourth emperor of Japan (who reigned from February 4, 488, to September 9, 498.)
sen.cmt: 日付のを訂正しました。
sen.e: Emperor Ninken (449 – September 9, 498) was the twenty-fourth emperor of Japan (who reigned from February 4, 488, to September 9, 498.)

sen.j: 億計天皇（おけのすめらみこと）・大石尊（おおしのみこと）、意祁命・意富祁王（おおけのみこ）。
sen.e: He was also known as Oke no Sumeramikoto, Oshi no Mikoto or Oke no Miko (expressed as意祁命 or 意富祁命).

He was also known as Oke no sumeramikoto (the term sumeramikoto refers to emperor), Oshi no mikoto (the term mikoto refers to god or person of great importance), or Oke no miko (which was written as "意祁命" or "意富祁王" in Japanese).
sen.cmt: 形式、補足、誤字修正しました。
sen.e: He was also known as Oke no sumeramikoto (the term sumeramikoto refers to emperor), Oshi no mikoto (the term mikoto refers to god or person of great importance), or Oke no miko (which was written as "意祁命" or "意富祁王" in Japanese).

sen.j: 諱は大脚（おおし）または大為（おおす）、字は嶋郎（しまのいらつこ）。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) was Oshi or Osu, and his azana (adult male's nickname) was Shima no Iratsuko.
His imina (real name) was Oshi or Osu, and his azana (male adult's courtesy name) was Shima no iratsuko.
sen.cmt: 用語、言い回しを変更しました。
sen.e: His imina (real name) was Oshi or Osu, and his azana (male adult's courtesy name) was Shima no iratsuko.

sen.j: 履中天皇の孫、市辺押磐皇子（いちのへのおしはのみこ）の子。
sen.e: He was a grandchild of the Emperor Richu and was a son of Prince Ichinohe no Oshihano.
He was a grandson of Emperor Richu and a son of Ichinohe no oshiha no miko (the term miko refers to imperial prince).
He was a grandson of Emperor Richu and a son of Ichinohe no oshiha no miko (the term miko refers to imperial prince).

sen.j: 母は媛（はえひめ、葛城蟻臣の女）。
sen.e: His mother was Haehime (a daughter of KATSURAGI no Ariomi).
His mother was Haehime (a daughter of KATSURAGI no Ariomi).
His mother was Haehime (a daughter of KATSURAGI no Ariomi).

sen.j: 顕宗天皇の同母兄。
sen.e: He was an older maternal half brother of the Emperor Kenzo.
He was an older brother of Emperor Kenzo.
He was an older brother of Emperor Kenzo.

sen.j: （ただし、『播磨国風土記』は母を手白髪命とする。）
sen.e: (According to "Harimanokuni Fudoki," his mother was Tashiraka no Mikoto.)
(According to "Harimanokuni Fudoki" [literally, the Records of the Culture and Geography of the Harima Province], however, his mother was Tashiraka no mikoto.)
(According to "Harimanokuni Fudoki" [literally, the Records of the Culture and Geography of the Harima Province], however, his mother was Tashiraka no mikoto.)

sen.j: 都は石上広高宮（いそのかみのひろたかのみや。）
sen.e: The palace was ISONOKAMI no Hirotakanomiya.
It was Isonokami no hirotaka no miya Palace in the capital.
sen.cmt: 形式、訳漏れ、原文文末の括弧を追加しました。
sen.e: It was Isonokami no hirotaka no miya Palace in the capital.

sen.j: （奈良県天理市石上町、あるいは同市嘉幡か）。
sen.e: Supposedly it is located in Isonokami Town, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture, or Kabata Town in the same city.
(Supposedly, it was located in Isonokami-cho Town, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture, or Kabata in the same city.)
sen.cmt: 原文文頭の括弧追加しました。
sen.e: (Supposedly, it was located in Isonokami-cho Town, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture, or Kabata in the same city.)

tit.cmt: 統一用語にあわせました

sen.j: 安康天皇3年（456年）に父の市辺押磐皇子が雄略天皇に殺されると、弟の弘計王（後の顕宗天皇）と共に逃亡して身を隠した。
sen.e: He and his younger brother Oke no Mikoto (later the Emperor Kenzo) escaped and hid together when his father Prince Ichinohe no Oshihano was murdered by the Emperor Yuryaku.

After his father Ichinohe no oshiha no miko was murdered by Emperor Yuryaku, Oke no miko (written as "億計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Ninken) and his younger brother Oke no mikoto (written as "弘計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Kenzo) escaped and hid together.
sen.cmt: 兄弟の名の読みが同じ為、違いを明確にすべく漢字表記を補足しました。文脈を調整しました。
sen.e: After his father Ichinohe no oshiha no miko was murdered by Emperor Yuryaku, Oke no miko (written as "億計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Ninken) and his younger brother Oke no mikoto (written as "弘計王" in Japanese, who was the future Emperor Kenzo) escaped and hid together.

sen.j: まず丹波国与謝郡（丹後半島東半）に逃げ、後には播磨国明石に住む。
sen.e: First they fled to Yosa County, Tanba Province (located in the eastern area of Tango Peninsula), and then moved to Akashi in Harima Province.
First, they fled to Yosa-gun County in Tanba Province (located in the eastern area of the Tango Peninsula), thereafter moving to Akashi in Harima Province.
sen.cmt: 言い回しを変更しました。
sen.e: First, they fled to Yosa-gun County in Tanba Province (located in the eastern area of the Tango Peninsula), thereafter moving to Akashi in Harima Province.

sen.j: 兄弟共に名を変えて丹波小子（たにわのわらわ）と称した。
sen.e: They used false names, Taniwa no warawa.
They used a collective false name, Taniwa no warawa (literally, children of Tanba).
They used a collective false name, Taniwa no warawa (literally, children of Tanba).

sen.j: 縮見屯倉首（しじみのみやけのおびと）に雇われて牛馬の飼育に携わっていた。
sen.e: They were hired by Shijimi no Miyake no Obito (chieftain of the Imperial-controlled territory called Shijimino miyake) and engaged in farming of horses and cattle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were hired by Shijimi no Miyake no Obito (chieftain of the Imperially-controlled territory called Shijimino miyake) and engaged in farming of horses and cattle.
sen.cmt: 形式、文法に対応しました。
sen.e: They were hired by Shijimi no Miyake no Obito (chieftain of the Imperially-controlled territory called Shijimino miyake) and engaged in farming of horses and cattle.

sen.j: 清寧天皇2年（481年）に、弟王が宴の席で王族の身分を明かした。
sen.e: In 481, at a drinking party, the younger prince revealed that they were members of the imperial family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 481, at a banquet, the younger prince revealed that they were members of the imperial family.
In 481, at a banquet, the younger prince revealed that they were members of the imperial family.

sen.j: 清寧天皇は、子がなかったため喜んで迎えを遣わし、翌年（482年）に2王を宮中に迎え入れた。
sen.e: Since the Emperor Seinei had no children, he found this as an opportunity and welcomed the brothers into the imperial palace in 482.
Since Emperor Seinei had no children, he welcomed the two brothers into the imperial palace in 482.
Since Emperor Seinei had no children, he welcomed the two brothers into the imperial palace in 482.

sen.j: 4月に億計王が皇太子となった。
sen.e: In April, the younger prince Oke no Mikoto became a crown prince.
In April, the older prince Oke no miko ("億計王") became the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 誤訳訂正、補足しました。
sen.e: In April, the older prince Oke no miko ("億計王") became the crown prince.

sen.j: 同5年（484年）に清寧天皇が崩じたときに皇位（王位）を弟王と譲り合った。
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Seinei in 484, both of the two brothers thought the other was more suitable to succeed to the throne, and tried to relinquish the position to the other.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the death of Emperor Seinei in 484, both of the two brothers thought the other was more suitable to succeed to the throne, and tried to give the emperorship to the other.
sen.cmt: 言い回しを変更しました。
sen.e: After the death of Emperor Seinei in 484, both of the two brothers thought the other was more suitable to succeed to the throne, and tried to give the emperorship to the other.

sen.j: その間飯豊青皇女が執政した。
sen.e: During that confusion, Iitoyo no himemiko carried out the affairs of state.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During that period, Iitoyo ao no himemiko (the term himemiko refers to imperial princess) administered the affairs of state.
During that period, Iitoyo ao no himemiko (the term himemiko refers to imperial princess) administered the affairs of state.

sen.j: 翌年、弟王が即位し（顕宗天皇）となったが、わずか在位3年で崩御した。
sen.e: The next year the younger prince succeeded to the throne to become the Emperor Kenzo, but he passed away only three years after.
The next year the younger prince succeeded to the throne to become Emperor Kenzo, but he passed away only three years later.
The next year the younger prince succeeded to the throne to become Emperor Kenzo, but he passed away only three years later.

sen.j: これを受けて億計王が仁賢天皇元年1月（488年2月）に即位した。
sen.e: Therefore the older prince Oke no Mikoto ascended the throne in February 488.
Therefore, the older prince Oke no mikoto ("億計王") ascended the throne in February, 488, thus becoming Emperor Ninken.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦対応月を補足、漢字表記補足しました。、形式
sen.e: Therefore, the older prince Oke no mikoto ("億計王") ascended the throne in February, 488, thus becoming Emperor Ninken.

sen.j: 3年2月（490年3月）に石上部（いそのかみべ）舎人を、5年（492年）に佐伯造（さえきのみやつこ）を置いた。
sen.e: He established the position of Isonokamibe Toneri (Officer of the Isonokamibe) in March 490, and Saeki no miyatsuko in 492.
He established the positions of Isonokamibe Toneri (Officer of the Isonokamibe) in March, 490, and Saeki no miyatsuko in 492.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦対応月を補足
sen.e: He established the positions of Isonokamibe Toneri (Officer of the Isonokamibe) in March, 490, and Saeki no miyatsuko in 492.

sen.j: また、6年9月（493年10月）に高句麗（こま）へ日鷹吉士（ひたかのきし）を遣わし、皮の工匠などの手工業者を招いたとされる。
sen.e: In September 493, he dispatched HITAKA no Kishi to Goguryeo and invited craftsmen, for example, leather masters.
In September, 493, he dispatched HITAKA no Kishi to Koma (Goguryeo) and invited manufacturers of handicrafts, for example, master tanners.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦対応月を補足、用語
sen.e: In September, 493, he dispatched HITAKA no Kishi to Koma (Goguryeo) and invited manufacturers of handicrafts, for example, master tanners.

sen.j: 仁賢天皇の時代は国中が良く治まり、人民から「天下は仁に帰し、民はその生業に安んじている」と評された。
sen.e: The Emperor Ninken ruled the country very well, and people said that the world was well governed by the emperor and the citizens were happy in their everyday work.
The Emperor Ninken ruled the country very well, and people said that the world was well governed by the emperor and the citizens were happy in their everyday work.
The Emperor Ninken ruled the country very well, and people said that the world was well governed by the emperor and the citizens were happy in their everyday work.

sen.j: 7年1月（494年2月）には皇子の小泊瀬稚鷦鷯尊を皇太子に定めた。
sen.e: In January 494, he appointed the prince Ohatsuse no wakasagi no mikoto as the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In January, 494, the Emperor designated his son Ohatsuse no wakasazaki no mikoto as the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦対応月を補足、人名読み訂正しました、形式
sen.e: In January, 494, the Emperor designated his son Ohatsuse no wakasazaki no mikoto as the crown prince.

sen.j: 11年8月（498年9月）に崩御。
sen.e: In August 498, he died.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In September, 498, the Emperor died.
sen.cmt: 原文に西暦対応月を補足、人名読み訂正しました、形式
sen.e: In September, 498, the Emperor died.

sen.j: 『水鏡』に50歳、『帝王編年記』には51歳とある。
sen.e: According to "Mizukagami" (The Water Mirror), he was 50 years old when he died and according to "Teio Hennen ki" (the Chronicle of emperors), he was 51.
His age at death was 50 according to "Mizukagami" (literally, the Water Mirror) or 51 according to "Teio hennenki" (literally, Annals of the emperor).
sen.cmt: 言い回し、形式、用語、書名定訳：http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=XpyR7KHkvc0C&pg=PA337&lpg=PA337&dq=Teio+hennenki,+Chronicles+of+emperors&source=bl&ots=wijgNt95Xx&sig=OQVcxLJfnfyQrzPVKQA2oTW3i6I&hl=ja&ei=3odnTLuDCoOWuAPjp5X-Aw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDAQ6AEwBA#v=onepage&q=Teio%20hennenki&f=false
sen.e: His age at death was 50 according to "Mizukagami" (literally, the Water Mirror) or 51 according to "Teio hennenki" (literally, Annals of the emperor).

sen.j: 皇后は雄略天皇の皇女である春日大娘皇女である。
sen.e: His wife was Kasuga no Oiratsume no Himemiko, a daughter of the Emperor Yuryaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Emperor Ninken's consort was Kasuga no oiratsume no himemiko, a daughter of the Emperor Yuryaku.
The Emperor Ninken's consort was Kasuga no oiratsume no himemiko, a daughter of the Emperor Yuryaku.

sen.j: 父を殺された雄略天皇の皇女を皇后とした理由として、仁賢天皇自身が傍系の出身であるため、直系の皇女を皇后に迎え入れ正当性を強めたと考えられている。
sen.e: The reason he chose her as his wife although her father Emperor Yuryaku had killed his father is supposed to be that he wanted to establish the legitimacy of his enthronement by marrying a lineal princess, since he himself was in a collateral line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Emperor Ninken chose her as his wife despite the fact that her father Emperor Yuryaku had murdered his father, supposedly in an attempt to enhance legitimacy of his emperorship by marrying an imperial princess who directly descended from the legitimate emperor, where he himself was a collateral descent.

The Emperor Ninken chose her as his wife despite the fact that her father Emperor Yuryaku had murdered his father, supposedly in an attempt to enhance legitimacy of his emperorship by marrying an imperial princess who directly descended from the legitimate emperor, where he himself was a collateral descent.

sen.j: これは娘の手白香皇女も、傍系出身の継体天皇の皇后となった事で繰り返されている。
sen.e: This tactics was used again when his daughter Princess Tashiraka married to the Emperor Keitai, who was in a collateral line.
This tactics was used again when his daughter Tashiraka no himemiko married Emperor Keitai who was in a collateral line.
This tactics was used again when his daughter Tashiraka no himemiko married Emperor Keitai who was in a collateral line.

sen.j: 埴生坂本陵（はにゅうのさかもとのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: He was buried in Hanyu no Sakamoto no Misasagi (Hanyu no Sakamoto Mausoleum).
The Emperor Ninken's body was buried in Hanyu no sakamoto no misasagi (mausoleum).
The Emperor Ninken's body was buried in Hanyu no sakamoto no misasagi (mausoleum).

sen.j: 同陵は大阪府藤井寺市青山3丁目の野中ボケ山古墳（前方後円墳・全長120m）に治定される。
sen.e: Nonaka Bokeyama Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound; 120m in length) located at 3-chome, Aoyama, Fujiidera City, Osaka Prefecture is authorized as the mausoleum.
The authorized location of the misasagi is Nonaka Bokeyama-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound of 120 meters in the total length) located at 3-chome, Aoyama, Fujiidera City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 言い回しを変更しました。
sen.e: The authorized location of the misasagi is Nonaka Bokeyama-kofun Tumulus (a keyhole-shaped mound of 120 meters in the total length) located at 3-chome, Aoyama, Fujiidera City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: また、神戸市西区押部谷町木津には、仁賢・顕宗両帝を祭神とする顕宗仁賢神社がある。
sen.e: Kenzo Ninken Jinja Shrine, where Emperors Ninken and Kenzo are enshrined, is located in Kizu, Oshibedani-town, Nishi Ward, Kobe City.
Further, Kenzo Ninken-jinja Shrine where Emperors Ninken and Kenzo are enshrined is located in Kizu, Oshibedani-cho Town, Nishi Ward, Kobe City.
sen.cmt: 形式、原文のリンク先表示（神戸市）削除
sen.e: Further, Kenzo Ninken-jinja Shrine where Emperors Ninken and Kenzo are enshrined is located in Kizu, Oshibedani-cho Town, Nishi Ward, Kobe City.

sen.j: 最寄り駅は神戸電鉄神鉄粟生線木津駅 (兵庫県)。
sen.e: The nearest station is Kizu Station in Hyogo Prefecture (Ao Line, Kobe Electric Railway).
The nearest station is Kizu Station of the Shintetsu (Kobe Electric Railway) Ao Line (Hyogo Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 言い回しを変更しました。
sen.e: The nearest station is Kizu Station of the Shintetsu (Kobe Electric Railway) Ao Line (Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: また、この神社の他に神戸市西区内や明石市や三木市には所縁を称する神社が数多くある。
sen.e: In addition to this shrine, there are many other shrines that are supposed to have ties with those emperors in Nishi Ward in Kobe City, Akashi City and Miki City.
sen.cmt: 「神戸市西区」と補っています（明石市西区と読めてしまうため）
sen.e: In addition to this shrine, there are many other shrines that are supposed to have ties with the Emperor Ninken in Nishi Ward of Kobe City, Akashi City and Miki City.
sen.cmt: 原文に「神戸市」補足、曖昧さ回避
sen.e: In addition to this shrine, there are many other shrines that are supposed to have ties with the Emperor Ninken in Nishi Ward of Kobe City, Akashi City and Miki City.
